message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a deep learning-based approach for reconstructing 3D human body shape from 2D orthographic views using binary mask images. This involves computer vision (CV) techniques such as image processing and feature extraction, which suggests that cs.CV is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions applications in 3D game and virtual reality (GR), which further supports the inclusion of cs.GR as a likely sub-category. The use of deep learning networks for regression tasks indicates that cs.LG is also a possible sub-category. The paper proposes data augmentation schemes, which suggests that cs.MM (multimedia) could also be a relevant sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the use of machine learning techniques for 3D reconstruction, which suggests that cs.AI (artificial intelligence) is also a possible sub-category.
